> [[ UI Messenger – Smith ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: For a little while. I needed a place to lay low, but found out yours wasn't a good choice.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I, uhm, had to break one of your drones.
> [[ Smith ]]: I apologize on the proximity sensor's behalf. I'm glad you're unhurt.
> [[ Smith ]]: Needless to say, I was not expecting friends. Don't worry about the drone.
> [[ Smith ]]: Viscerators are cheap, if that eases your mind any. The sensor is actually the most expensive part.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: ...They're called viscerators?
> [[ Smith ]]: Endearing, isn't it?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Something like that.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I, uhm, saw your trophy case, though.
> [[ Smith ]]: Did you, now?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: From killing Nameless, right?
> [[ Smith ]]: Ah, yes.
> [[ Smith ]]: Most certainly.
> [[ Smith ]]: Yes, I've amassed quite a collection. The technology they operate with exceeds anything we players have access to so far, barring the message board server.
> [[ Smith ]]: But I've yet to find any useful application for them. Nothing I've yet tried has allowed me to disassemble one, much less restore a broken one to function.
> [[ Smith ]]: I have theories. Interesting theories, but that's a discussion topic for another time.
> [[ Smith ]]: All that said, I was just about to return to my workshop, albeit briefly.
> [[ Smith ]]: Do you think you could meet me by one of the gates, or perhaps the warehouse district?

> “We're about to head out. The gate sounds fine.”
> Suggest meeting elsewhere. (Write-in)
> Ask about something else. (Write-in)
